medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe abdominal pain with associated nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately five days ago with mild abdominal pain, progressing to severe pain today with soreness and intermittent spasms. Pain localizes to the epigastrium, periumbilical, and left abdominal quadrant, and does not radiate. Pain was not relieved by Tums and was not associated with oral intake. Last bowel movement was normal.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, bilateral hand DIP osteoarthritis, urinary tract infection treated with antibiotics two weeks ago.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had DM2 and gallbladder disease. Many family members have hypertension.
